page.title: 05FARMING IN KIP VALLEY
page.content: There are eight farms in the area most of which are{PASTORAL,}keeping both beef and dairy cattle and sheep.This is because of the hilly landscape, cloudy, wet climate and the proximity of a large town,{Greenock. The farms range in size from 80 Ha to 220Ha, and all are tenants of {Ardgowan Estate. The majority of the farms have no employees and are family businesses. A few of the farms have expanded but at least two have lost land in recent years, one to private housing, one to {Inverkip Power Station. Farmers find problems being close to a large town like Greenock. Dogs worrying livestock, poachers and vandals damaging the farmers property. The general attitude of farmers is, the climate can be too wet, but otherwise conditions are satisfactory.
